[h1] Bu Oyun Neyin Nesi? [/h1]
Blue Shift Half-life oyunumuzun güvenlik olarak oynadığımız hali. Aynı evren ve aynı zamanda geçtiği için tüm oyunları oynayarak herkesin yerinde olma şansınız var. Blue Shift'i oynarken gayet eğlendim ve sevdim. Türkçe yamayla oynadığım için anlamakta  herhangi bir problem yaşamadan direkt olarak kendimi hikayeye kaptırabildim. Eğer ki yama yapmayı isterseniz ve kurmakta sorun yaşarsanız benimle iletişim kurabilirsiniz.

cool game and give context to how barney escaped black mesa
Not bad, just boring. Doesn't really do anything unique despite you being Barney.

EDIT: I just wrote this when I am editing, but I forgot to mention that it would give some cool Half Life 2 context if it's canon. I heard that this and Opposing Force are of questionable canonicity. It's also cool how Gearbox made this with Dreamcast limitations in mind, which explains the missing OF content.

My opinions on Blue Shift are a bit mixed, but generally positive. My expectations were high coming out of Opposing Force, and I came into that with low hopes. Thinking of this game as a side story instead of a full on Half Life game like Opposing Force is the best way to approach it. The combat is still fun as ever, though it's disappointing that the Opposing Force weapons didn't return. I think Blue Shift does a better job at giving a different Resonance Cascade point of view than Opposing Force does, which is cool. I really don't have much to say here other than it was a decent experience. If you can't get both this and Opposing Force, go with the latter.
Short and sweet and not as varied as the original or OF, but still quite fun and with a good story.

A very good and short expansion pack starring the Beerman-lad Barney himself! It tries it's own things and I like that. Wouldn't call it much more then a mappack though. 8/10

less content then HL/HL:OP, but I would still get excited when I saw something from a new angle. With some new game law, and a badge on your vest, you'll have a good afternoon of game-play. I finished this in 3 hours for a casual play-through. I had a few of the same bugs I got in Half-Life Opposing Force (key looping, visual bugs, etc). though I fixed them with the same methods as last time (my review on HL:OP has the fixes). Would recommend to any Half-Life fans wanting a little more.

The fact that you see things from the other two games is my favourite bit

Like Opposing Force, Gearbox has managed to come up with a fun campaign that offers very different gameplay from the main game. There are fewer scripted sequences than in Opposing Force, but the content here is still fun, with some great levels and encounters. Another feature of Blue Shift is that it offers a more palatable Xen tour than OpFor and the original Half-Life (though, this may be partly due to its simplicity). 

Blue Shift's final scene is more interesting than Opposing Force's, but its actual ending is more prosaic than the end of Adrian Shephard's story, which has left players wondering about his ultimate fate since the mission pack was first released. Maybe it's because of Half-Life 2 that we really know what happened to Barney Calhoun, but once the credits roll, it's unlikely that ending will hold you back.

kontynuacja, warto poświęcić 4 goidzny.

- This DLC//ExpansionPack adds a VERY SHORT single-player campaign, set on several new maps.
- If you enjoyed the original Half Life campaign and want some more of the same, I recommend getting this (when it's on sale).

- A few FIXES worth mentioning are: 
1. Mouse glitch fix - go to OPTIONS, in the MOUSE submenu be sure to check "Mouse Raw Input"
2. Field Of View fix - by pressing tilde (~) on your keyboard during gameplay you'll bring up the console; there type in "default_fov 90" and change the 90 with 100 or 110.

- Be sure to check out "Black Mesa: Blue Shift" which is a remake of Half Life Blue Shift. Hopefully, by the time you read this it will be finished and released for free, over at www.moddb.com

Ещё одно дополнение к Half Life - Blue Shift. После прохождение HL - OF чувствуется почему про эту игру говорят так мало или вообще не упоминают. Главное это второстепенность происходящего! Играя за Барни Калхаун (Калхун) - А именно за него обычного охранника Черной Мезы что просто начинается с обычной смены а потом всё по тому месту, но в отличе от Фримена и Шепарда мы действуем отдельно от всего не влезая в ветку событий Фримена кардинально, участвуя в побеге из Чёрной Мезы. Я лишь описываю главное о чём говорят игроки когда говорят про это дополнение. Но я так не считаю и рекомендую пройти этот спинов ведь главное это вернуть пиво Гордону Фримену!
É uma expansão bem curta sem nada demais, porem ainda sim muito boa, essa expansão ta mais para aqueles que ja finalizaram Half Life 1 e querem um pouquinho mais

Would only recommend this to completionists like myself that want to play every installment in the Half Life series. If just a casual Half Life fan (if those even exist anymore), skip this. The story is only cool because it explains how Barney got out of Black Mesa alive. Other than that, it's a janky, clunky fps with a full spectrum of mediocre-to-god-awful game design. A 4/10. Not a fun experience.

Lo que me gusto es que se ve los sucesos de Half life desde otra perspectiva. Lo que no me gusto, es que la mayor parte del juego tiene audios en ingles, y No en español. Por lo que si no sos muy dado, o no prestas atencion a lo que dicen los doctores, vas a estar dando vueltas en el mismo mapa como un boludo. Es un juego medio corto, pero entretenido, para pasarselo en una noche.

Agora que comprei com meu próprio dinheiro posso afirmar que não é shooter, é puzzle.

Made by Gearbox Software and originally released in 2001 as an add-on to Half-Life, Blue Shift is a return to the Black Mesa Research Facility in which you play as Barney Calhoun, the security guard sidekick who helped Gordon out of so many sticky situations.
